title: Information Exposure Through Directory Listing
content:
Summary:
Directory listing is a web server function that displays the directory contents when there is no index file in a specific website directory. It is dangerous to leave this function turned on for the web server because it leads to information disclosure.
Steps To Reproduce:
Go to this URL: ███
You can see logs files
████
████████
PoC:
Code 555 Bytes
1██████████ - - [█████:████ +0000] "GET /api/live/ws HTTP/1.1" 400 3325 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4638.69 Safari/537.36"
2█████ - - [█████:████ +0000] "GET /api/live/ws HTTP/1.1" 400 3325 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/97.0.4692.99 Safari/537.36"
3█████ - - [██████████:██████████ +0000] "GET /api/live/ws HTTP/1.1" 400 872 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/95.0.4638.69 Safari/537.36"
Code 683 Bytes
1[███ █████ █████████████] [core:error] [pid 8186:tid 140028348987136] [client ███:47058] AH00126: Invalid URI in request GET /cgi-bin/.%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/etc/hosts HTTP/1.1
2[██████ ████████████ ██████████] [authz_core:error] [pid 8186:tid 140027803723520] [client ██████████:47426] AH01630: client denied by server configuration: proxy:███████████
3[████ ████████████ ██████████] [ssl:error] [pid 11243:tid ████] [client ████████:42490] AH02042: rejecting client initiated renegotiation
4[█████ ████ ████] [proxy:error] [pid 4547:tid 140029011683072] (111)Connection refused: AH00957: HTTP: attempt to connect to ████:3000 (████████████) failed
Impact
Information Disclosure
steps: Navigate to the target URL where directory listing is enabled (███)
Observe the exposed directory contents, including sensitive log files
vuln_description: Directory listing is a web server function that displays the contents of a directory when no index file is present. This can lead to information disclosure as sensitive files (e.g., logs) may be exposed to unauthorized users.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it only requires accessing a URL where directory listing is enabled. There are no complex interactions or state manipulations involved.
